item.title: Beogram 4000: New Arrival from Italy
item.description:
I’m thrilled to be working on another Beogram 4000 restoration. The unit arrived from overseas in just three days and was packaged very well, ensuring its safe arrival. The exterior looks good overall. The wood veneer is undamaged and the dust cover can be polished back to its original shine. The aluminum trim on the back of the dust cover needs to be reattached, which should be a simple fix. Inside, the aluminum plates need a thorough cleaning...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the Tracking Force and Replacing the Strange Original Front Center Cabinet Guiding Washer
item.description:
My Beogram 4000 restoration is complete, and it’s playing beautifully. As I write this, I’m enjoying “Song for My Father” by Horace Silver on a reissue, as original pressings are unfortunately outside my budget these days. One of the final tasks was refining the Beogram’s mechanics. I calibrated the tonearm weight and limits and replaced the guiding washer, which ensures the plinth moves smoothly. The original washer, pictured below, has a design flaw that was later corrected in the Beogram 400x series...
